goal.parser

Class InputStreamPosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.InputStreamPosition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<InputStreamPosition>

    public class InputStreamPosition
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<InputStreamPosition>, java.io.Serializable
    Describes a single position in a file or stream by saving its line number and position on that line.
    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getLineNumber

        public int getLineNumber()
        Returns:
        The line number this marker marks.

      • getCharacterPosition

        public int getCharacterPosition()
        Returns:
        The index of the character in its line that this marker marks.

      • getStartIndex

        public int getStartIndex()
        Returns:
        The (token) startindex of the character that this marker marks.

      • getStopIndex

        public int getStopIndex()
        Returns:
        The (token) stopindex of the character that this marker marks.

      • getSourceFile

        public java.io.File getSourceFile()
        Returns:
        The file this InputStreamPosition is located in. May be null if it was generated from a string.

      • setID

        public void setID(int id)
        Sets the numerical identifier for this InputStreamPosition. If this is not called, the value will be -1.
        Parameters:
        id - The numerical identifier

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Returns:
        The numerical identifier for this InputStreamPosition. The default value is -1.

      • toShortString

        public java.lang.String toShortString()
        Returns:
        A short representation of this InputStreamPosition. The returned value is of the format L<LINE>, C<COL>.

      • definedAfter

        public boolean definedAfter(java.io.File file,
                   int lineNumber)
        Determines if this InputStreamPosition is located after the given location. WARNING: the line number is 0-based, while the line number in this InputStreamPosition is 1-based.
        Parameters:
        file - The referenced file.
        lineNumber - The referenced line number.
        Returns:
        true iff this InputStreamPosition is located in the given file, after or at the start of the given line.
